text:
Hi Jarl! How are you?
First of all I wanted to apologise for not having answered. I had to go back to Argentina and things were really complicated so I did not have much time to work on my personal stuff and such. But when I was thinking that I had to stay there, I was sent a job offer as a Graphic Designer at a startup software company here in London. I doubted it as I really want to get myself into the VFX industry, but I thought this was an opportunity for me to start gaining work experience in London, also having access to all the events/exhibitions that constantly inspire me and be able to network in person. So I decided to take the job, as also it was a One year contract. So right now I came back to London (I arrived on last Saturday so I’m settling down in these days), and started working on Monday. The place is really nice, I know it’s probably not where I want to work forever in terms of creativity and what I do there, so It’s up to me to keep on working on personal projects on my free time, so more or less in October I start looking for another job (the contract ends in February).
So, sorry for writing so much! That’s a brief story of what’s been going on since we last spoke
Any comments/suggestions would be really helpful :)

I’m also thinking of buying a good notebook from which I can work on my projects because right now I have a Macbook pro and it’s not very good. But I find it hard to start doing stuff as I am in a “transition” moment
